SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity >=0.6.0 <0.8.0;\n\nimport \"../utils/EnumerableSet.sol\";\nimport \"../utils/Address.sol\";\nimport \"../utils/Context.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev Contract module that allows children to implement role-based access\n * control mechanisms.\n *\n * Roles are referred to by their `bytes32` identifier. These should be exposed\n * in the external API and be unique. The best way to achieve this is by\n * using `public constant` hash digests:\n *\n * ```\n * bytes32 public constant MY_ROLE = keccak256(\"MY_ROLE\");\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be used to represent a set of permissions. To restrict access to a\n * function call, use {hasRole}:\n *\n * ```\n * function foo() public {\n *     require(hasRole(MY_ROLE, msg.sender));\n *     ...\n * }\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be granted and revoked dynamically via the {grantRole} and\n * {revokeRole} functions. Each role has an associated admin role, and only\n * accounts that have a role's admin role can call {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.\n *\n * By default, the admin role for all roles is `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`, which means\n * that only accounts with this role will be able to grant or revoke other\n * roles. More complex role relationships can be created by using\n * {_setRoleAdmin}.\n *\n * WARNING: The `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is also its own admin: it has permission to\n * grant and revoke this role. Extra precautions should be taken to secure\n * accounts that have been granted it.\n */\nabstract contract AccessControl is Context {\n    using EnumerableSet for EnumerableSet.AddressSet;\n    using Address for address;\n\n    struct RoleData {\n        EnumerableSet.AddressSet members;\n        bytes32 adminRole;\n    }\n\n    mapping (bytes32 => RoleData) private _roles;\n\n    bytes32 public constant DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE = 0x00;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole`\n     *\n     * `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite\n     * {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.\n     *\n     * _Available since v3.1._\n     */\n    event RoleAdminChanged(bytes32 indexed role, bytes32 indexed previousAdminRole, bytes32 indexed newAdminRole);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when `account` is granted `role`.\n     *\n     * `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role\n     * bearer except when using {_setupRole}.\n     */\n    event RoleGranted(bytes32 indexed role, address indexed account, address indexed sender);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`.\n     *\n     * `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:\n     *   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer\n     *   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)\n     */\n    event RoleRevoked(bytes32 indexed role, address indexed account, address indexed sender);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`.\n     */\n    function hasRole(bytes32 role, address account) public view returns (bool) {\n        return _roles[role].members.contains(account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used\n     * together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.\n     */\n    function getRoleMemberCount(bytes32 role) public view returns (uint256) {\n        return _roles[role].members.length();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a\n     * value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive.\n     *\n     * Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may\n     * change at any point.\n     *\n     * WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure\n     * you perform all queries on the same block. See the following\n     * https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post]\n     * for more information.\n     */\n    function getRoleMember(bytes32 role, uint256 index) public view returns (address) {\n        return _roles[role].members.at(index);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and\n     * {revokeRole}.\n     *\n     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.\n     */\n    function getRoleAdmin(bytes32 role) public view returns (bytes32) {\n        return _roles[role].adminRole;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Grants `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.\n     */\n    function grantRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual {\n        require(hasRole(_roles[role].adminRole, _msgSender()), \"AccessControl: sender must be an admin to grant\");\n\n        _grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.\n     */\n    function revokeRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual {\n        require(hasRole(_roles[role].adminRole, _msgSender()), \"AccessControl: sender must be an admin to revoke\");\n\n        _revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from the calling account.\n     *\n     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's\n     * purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges\n     * if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).\n     *\n     * If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must be `account`.\n     */\n    function renounceRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual {\n        require(account == _msgSender(), \"AccessControl: can only renounce roles for self\");\n\n        _revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Grants `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted}\n     * event. Note that unlike {grantRole}, this function doesn't perform any\n     * checks on the calling account.\n     *\n     * [WARNING]\n     * ====\n     * This function should only be called from the constructor when setting\n     * up the initial roles for the system.\n     *\n     * Using this function in any other way is effectively circumventing the admin\n     * system imposed by {AccessControl}.\n     * ====\n     */\n    function _setupRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal virtual {\n        _grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Sets `adminRole` as ``role``'s admin role.\n     *\n     * Emits a {RoleAdminChanged} event.\n     */\n    function _setRoleAdmin(bytes32 role, bytes32 adminRole) internal virtual {\n        emit RoleAdminChanged(role, _roles[role].adminRole, adminRole);\n        _roles[role].adminRole = adminRole;\n    }\n\n    function _grantRole(bytes32 role, address account) private {\n        if (_roles[role].members.add(account)) {\n            emit RoleGranted(role, account, _msgSender());\n        }\n    }\n\n    function _revokeRole(bytes32 role, address account) private {\n        if (_roles[role].members.remove(account)) {\n            emit RoleRevoked(role, account, _msgSender());\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x4fc155a2f7837603d69a13cfa481eb5e7f5e02cb77e2ec9edbac30986db37988","license":"MIT"},"@openzeppelin/contracts/math/SafeMath.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity >=0.6.0 <0.8.0;\n\n/**\n * @dev Wrappers over Solidity's arithmetic operations with added overflow\n * checks.\n *\n * Arithmetic operations in Solidity wrap on overflow. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was removed from the set, that is if it was\n     * present.\n     */\n    function _remove(Set storage set, bytes32 value) private returns (bool) {\n        // We read and store the value's index to prevent multiple reads from the same storage slot\n        uint256 valueIndex = set._indexes[value];\n\n        if (valueIndex != 0) { // Equivalent to contains(set, value)\n            // To delete an element from the _values array in O(1), we swap the element to delete with the last one in\n            // the array, and then remove the last element (sometimes called as 'swap and pop').\n            // This modifies the order of the array, as noted in {at}.\n\n            uint256 toDeleteIndex = valueIndex - 1;\n            uint256 lastIndex = set._values.length - 1;\n\n            // When the value to delete is the last one, the swap operation is unnecessary. However, since this occurs\n            // so rarely, we still do the swap anyway to avoid the gas cost of adding an 'if' statement.\n\n            bytes32 lastvalue = set._values[lastIndex];\n\n            // Move the last value to the index where the value to delete is\n            set._values[toDeleteIndex] = lastvalue;\n            // Update the index for the moved value\n            set._indexes[lastvalue] = toDeleteIndex + 1; // All indexes are 1-based\n\n            // Delete the slot where the moved value was stored\n            set._values.pop();\n\n            // Delete the index for the deleted slot\n            delete set._indexes[value];\n\n            return true;\n        } else {\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns true if the value is in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function _contains(Set storage set, bytes32 value) private view returns (bool) {\n        return set._indexes[value] != 0;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the number of values on the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function _length(Set storage set) private view returns (uint256) {\n        return set._values.length;\n    }\n\n   /**\n    * @dev Returns the value stored at position `index` in the set. O(1).\n    *\n    * Note that there are no guarantees on the ordering of values inside the\n    * array, and it may change when more values are added or removed.\n    *\n    * Requirements:\n    *\n    * - `index` must be strictly less than {length}.\n    */\n    function _at(Set storage set, uint256 index) private view returns (bytes32) {\n        require(set._values.length > index, \"EnumerableSet: index out of bounds\");\n        return set._values[index];\n    }\n\n    // Bytes32Set\n\n    struct Bytes32Set {\n        Set _inner;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Add a value to a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was added to the set, that is if it was not\n     * already present.\n     */\n    function add(Bytes32Set storage set, bytes32 value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _add(set._inner, value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Removes a value from a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was removed from the set, that is if it was\n     * present.\n     */\n    function remove(Bytes32Set storage set, bytes32 value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _remove(set._inner, value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns true if the value is in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function contains(Bytes32Set storage set, bytes32 value) internal view returns (bool) {\n        return _contains(set._inner, value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the number of values in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function length(Bytes32Set storage set) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return _length(set._inner);\n    }\n\n   /**\n    * @dev Returns the value stored at position `index` in the set. O(1).\n    *\n    * Note that there are no guarantees on the ordering of values inside the\n    * array, and it may change when more values are added or removed.\n    *\n    * Requirements:\n    *\n    * - `index` must be strictly less than {length}.\n    */\n    function at(Bytes32Set storage set, uint256 index) internal view returns (bytes32) {\n        return _at(set._inner, index);\n    }\n\n    // AddressSet\n\n    struct AddressSet {\n        Set _inner;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Add a value to a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was added to the set, that is if it was not\n     * already present.\n     */\n    function add(AddressSet storage set, address value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _add(set._inner, bytes32(uint256(uint160(value))));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Removes a value from a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was removed from the set, that is if it was\n     * present.\n     */\n    function remove(AddressSet storage set, address value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _remove(set._inner, bytes32(uint256(uint160(value))));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns true if the value is in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function contains(AddressSet storage set, address value) internal view returns (bool) {\n        return _contains(set._inner, bytes32(uint256(uint160(value))));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the number of values in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function length(AddressSet storage set) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return _length(set._inner);\n    }\n\n   /**\n    * @dev Returns the value stored at position `index` in the set. O(1).\n    *\n    * Note that there are no guarantees on the ordering of values inside the\n    * array, and it may change when more values are added or removed.\n    *\n    * Requirements:\n    *\n    * - `index` must be strictly less than {length}.\n    */\n    function at(AddressSet storage set, uint256 index) internal view returns (address) {\n        return address(uint160(uint256(_at(set._inner, index))));\n    }\n\n\n    // UintSet\n\n    struct UintSet {\n        Set _inner;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Add a value to a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was added to the set, that is if it was not\n     * already present.\n     */\n    function add(UintSet storage set, uint256 value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _add(set._inner, bytes32(value));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Removes a value from a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was removed from the set, that is if it was\n     * present.\n     */\n    function remove(UintSet storage set, uint256 value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _remove(set._inner, bytes32(value));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns true if the value is in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function contains(UintSet storage set, uint256 value) internal view returns (bool) {\n        return _contains(set._inner, bytes32(value));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the number of values on the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function length(UintSet storage set) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return _length(set._inner);\n    }\n\n   /**\n    * @dev Returns the value stored at position `index` in the set. O(1).\n    *\n    * Note that there are no guarantees on the ordering of values inside the\n    * array, and it may change when more values are added or removed.\n    *\n    * Requirements:\n    *\n    * - `index` must be strictly less than {length}.\n    */\n    function at(UintSet storage set, uint256 index) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return uint256(_at(set._inner, index));\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x1562cd9922fbf739edfb979f506809e2743789cbde3177515542161c3d04b164","license":"MIT"},"contracts/IPrecogMarket.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.6.0 <0.8.0;\n\n/**\n * @title IPrecogMarket: simple interface to interact with all Precog Markets\n * @author Marto (https://github.com/0xMarto)\n * @dev Feel free to make any adjustments to the code (DMs are open @0xMarto)\n */\ninterface IPrecogMarket {\n    // Public market variables\n    function owner() external view returns (address);\n\n    function token() external view returns (address);\n\n    function id() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function totalOutcomes() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function oracle() external view returns (address);\n\n    function startTimestamp() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function endTimestamp() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function closeTimestamp() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function result() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function accountShares(address _account) external view returns (\n        uint256 buys, uint256 sells, uint256 deposited, uint256 withdrew, uint256 redeemed\n    );\n\n    // Events emitted by markets\n    event SharesBought(address indexed account, uint256 indexed outcome, uint256 amount, uint256 tokenIn);\n    event SharesSold(address indexed account, uint256 indexed outcome, uint256 amount, uint256 tokenOut);\n    event SharesRedeemed(address indexed account, uint256 indexed outcome, uint256 amount, uint256 tokenOut);\n    event OwnershipTransferred(address indexed previousOwner, address indexed newOwner);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initializes the contract with the specified token\n     * @param _token The address of the ERC-20 token to be used for buy, sell, and redeem shares\n     */\n    function initialize(address _token) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets up the market with the specified parameters\n     * @param _id The unique identifier for the market\n     * @param _oracle The address of the oracle that will report results\n     * @param _totalOutcomes The number of possible outcomes for the market\n     * @param _subsidy The initial funding used to seed the market (defined on initialized token)\n     * @param _overround The AMM profit margin in basis points (bps) [recommended: (100 * _totalOutcomes)]\n     */\n    function setup(uint256 _id, address _oracle, uint256 _totalOutcomes, uint256 _subsidy, uint256 _overround) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Buys outcome shares for the specified outcome\n     * @param _outcome The outcome of which shares are being bought (e.g.: 1 for YES, 2 for NO)\n     * @param _amount The number of outcome tokens to buy (as a signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)\n     * @return tokenCost The total token amount used for buying the specified amount of outcome shares\n     */\n    function buy(uint256 _outcome, int128 _amount) external returns (uint256 tokenCost);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Allows buying market shares for a specified account (limited to only Self or Owner)\n     * @param _outcome The outcome of which shares are being bought (e.g.: 1 for YES, 2 for NO)\n     * @param _amount The number of outcome shares to buy (as a signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)\n     * @param _account The address of the buyer\n     * @return tokenCost The total token amount used for buying the specified amount of outcome shares\n     */\n    function _buy(uint256 _outcome, int128 _amount, address _account) external returns (uint256 tokenCost);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sells outcome shares for the specified outcome\n     * @param _outcome The outcome of which shares are being sold (e.g.: 1 for YES, 2 for NO)\n     * @param _amount The number of outcome shares to sell (as a signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)\n     * @return tokenReturn The total amount of tokens received from selling the outcome shares\n     */\n    function sell(uint256 _outcome, int128 _amount) external returns (uint256 tokenReturn);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Allows selling market shares from a specified account (limited to only Self or Owner)\n     * @param _outcome The outcome for which tokens are being sold (e.g.: 1 for YES, 2 for NO)\n     * @param _amount The number of outcome tokens to sell (as a signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)\n     * @param _account The address of the seller\n     * @return tokenReturn The total amount of tokens received from selling the outcome shares\n     */\n    function _sell(uint256 _outcome, int128 _amount, address _account) external returns (uint256 tokenReturn);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Reports the result of the market (limited to only Oracle)\n     * @param _id The unique identifier of the market\n     * @param _outcome The outcome that is reported as the result of the market\n     */\n    function reportResult(uint256 _id, uint256 _outcome) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Redeems the current sender shares for the result of the market\n     * @return redeemedShares The number of shares redeemed\n     */\n    function redeemShares() external returns (uint256 redeemedShares);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Redeems the received account shares for the result of the market (limited to only Self or Owner)\n     * @param _account The address of the account with shares of the market\n     * @return redeemedShares The number of shares redeemed\n     */\n    function _redeem(address _account) external returns (uint256 redeemedShares);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Redeems shares in batch for multiple accounts  (limited to only Oracle)\n     * @param _accounts The list of accounts to redeem shares for\n     * @dev The list of accounts could be calculated using the \"SharesBought\" event\n     * @return redeems The number of successful redeems\n     */\n    function redeemBatch(address[] memory _accounts) external returns (uint256 redeems);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Withdraws any remaining liquidity from the market (limited to only owner)\n     * @param _token The address of the ERC-20 token to withdraw\n     */\n    function withdraw(address _token) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Transfers the ownership of the contract to a new owner (limited to only current owner)\n     * @param _newOwner The address of the new owner\n     */\n    function transferOwnership(address _newOwner) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Update the oracle address of the market (limited to only owner)\n     * @param _newOracle The address of the EOA or contract that can close the market\n     */\n    function updateOracle(address _newOracle) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Updates the start and end timestamps for the market (limited to only owner)\n     * @param _startTimestamp The timestamp when the market starts allowing trading\n     * @param _endTimestamp The timestamp when the market stops allowing trading\n     */\n    function updateDates(uint256 _startTimestamp, uint256 _endTimestamp) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Gets the total collateral spent in the market\n     * @return totalCost The total cost in the form of a signed 64.64-bit fixed point number\n     */\n    function cost() external view returns (int128 totalCost);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Gets the cost of buying the specified amount of outcome tokens\n     * @param _outcome The outcome for which tokens are being bought\n     * @param _amount The number of outcome tokens to buy (as signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)\n     * @return tokenCost The token cost amount (as a signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)\n     */\n    function buyPrice(uint256 _outcome, int128 _amount) external view returns (int128 tokenCost);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Gets the return from selling the specified amount of outcome tokens\n     * @param _outcome The outcome for which tokens are being sold\n     * @param _amount The number of outcome tokens to sell (as signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)\n     * @return tokenReturn The token return amount (as a signed 64.64-bit fixed point number)\n     */\n    function sellPrice(uint256 _outcome, int128 _amount) external view returns (int128 tokenReturn);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Gets the current market state information\n     * @return totalShares The current total shares minted for all outcomes of the market\n     * @return sharesBalances All shares balances (indexed by outcome)\n     * @return currentCost The current liquidity of the market\n     * @return totalBuys Buys counter of the market\n     * @return totalSells Sells counter of the market\n     */\n    function getMarketInfo() external view returns (\n        int128 totalShares, int128[] memory sharesBalances, int128 currentCost, uint256 totalBuys, uint256 totalSells\n    );\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Get current market buy and sell prices for all outcomes\n     * @dev Helper function to fast calculate market prediction and spreads\n     * @return buyPrices buy price of 1 share for all outcomes (indexed by outcome)\n     * @return sellPrices sell price of 1 share for all outcomes (indexed by outcome)\n     */\n    function getPrices() external view returns (uint256[] memory buyPrices, uint256[] memory sellPrices);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Gets the amount of shares that an account owns for all outcomes\n     * @param _account The address of the account with shares of the market\n     * @return balances The balances of shares for all outcomes (indexed by outcome)\n     */\n    function getAccountOutcomeBalances(address _account) external view returns (uint256[] memory balances);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x49673e3221d08716f383d19b5cd8db0de52fc0936d086e6a025de9b5e5fba2bd","license":"MIT"},"contracts/IRealityETH.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.6.0 <0.8.0;\n\n/**\n * @title IRealityETH\n * @dev Interface for Reality.eth Oracle Contract, does not include all functions\n * @notice This interface defines a partial set of the functions available in the \n * Reality.eth oracle, including only those used by the Precog protocol.\n */\ninterface IRealityETH {\n    /**\n     * @dev Ask a question to the Reality.eth oracle\n     * @param template_id The template ID for the question type\n     * @param question The question text\n     * @param arbitrator The arbitrator address for disputes\n     * @param timeout The timeout period in seconds\n     * @param opening_ts The opening timestamp\n     * @param nonce A unique nonce for the question\n     * @return question_id The unique identifier for the question\n     */\n    function askQuestion(\n        uint256 template_id,\n        string calldata question,\n        address arbitrator,\n        uint32 timeout,\n        uint32 opening_ts,\n        uint256 nonce\n    ) external payable returns (bytes32 question_id);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Ask a question with minimum bond\n     * @param template_id The template ID for the question type\n     * @param question The question text\n     * @param arbitrator The arbitrator address for disputes\n     * @param timeout The timeout period in seconds\n     * @param opening_ts The opening timestamp\n     * @param nonce A unique nonce for the question\n     * @param min_bond The minimum bond required\n     * @return question_id The unique identifier for the question\n     */\n    function askQuestionWithMinBond(\n        uint256 template_id,\n        string calldata question,\n        address arbitrator,\n        uint32 timeout,\n        uint32 opening_ts,\n        uint256 nonce,\n        uint256 min_bond\n    ) external payable returns (bytes32 question_id);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Submit an answer to a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID to answer\n     * @param answer The answer to submit\n     * @param max_previous Maximum number of previous answers to consider\n     */\n    function submitAnswer(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        uint256 max_previous\n    ) external payable;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the final answer for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The final answer\n     */\n    function getFinalAnswer(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the current result for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The current result\n     */\n    function resultFor(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Check if a question is finalized\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return True if the question is finalized\n     */\n    function isFinalized(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bool);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the best answer for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The best answer\n     */\n    function getBestAnswer(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the bond for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The bond amount\n     */\n    function getBond(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the bounty for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The bounty amount\n     */\n    function getBounty(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the arbitrator for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The arbitrator address\n     */\n    function getArbitrator(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (address);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the timeout for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The timeout period\n     */\n    function getTimeout(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (uint32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the opening timestamp for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The opening timestamp\n     */\n    function getOpeningTS(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (uint32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the finalize timestamp for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The finalize timestamp\n     */\n    function getFinalizeTS(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (uint32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the content hash for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The content hash\n     */\n    function getContentHash(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the history hash for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The history hash\n     */\n    function getHistoryHash(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the minimum bond for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The minimum bond\n     */\n    function getMinBond(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Check if a question is pending arbitration\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return True if pending arbitration\n     */\n    function isPendingArbitration(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bool);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Check if a question was settled too soon\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return True if settled too soon\n     */\n    function isSettledTooSoon(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bool);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Fund the answer bounty for a question\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     */\n    function fundAnswerBounty(bytes32 question_id) external payable;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Create a template\n     * @param content The template content\n     * @return The template ID\n     */\n    function createTemplate(string calldata content) external returns (uint256);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Create a template and ask a question\n     * @param content The template content\n     * @param question The question text\n     * @param arbitrator The arbitrator address\n     * @param timeout The timeout period\n     * @param opening_ts The opening timestamp\n     * @param nonce A unique nonce\n     * @return question_id The question ID\n     */\n    function createTemplateAndAskQuestion(\n        string calldata content,\n        string calldata question,\n        address arbitrator,\n        uint32 timeout,\n        uint32 opening_ts,\n        uint256 nonce\n    ) external payable returns (bytes32 question_id);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Reopen a question\n     * @param template_id The template ID\n     * @param question The question text\n     * @param arbitrator The arbitrator address\n     * @param timeout The timeout period\n     * @param opening_ts The opening timestamp\n     * @param nonce A unique nonce\n     * @param min_bond The minimum bond\n     * @param reopens_question_id The question ID to reopen\n     * @return question_id The new question ID\n     */\n    function reopenQuestion(\n        uint256 template_id,\n        string calldata question,\n        address arbitrator,\n        uint32 timeout,\n        uint32 opening_ts,\n        uint256 nonce,\n        uint256 min_bond,\n        bytes32 reopens_question_id\n    ) external payable returns (bytes32 question_id);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Submit answer for another address\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @param answer The answer\n     * @param max_previous Maximum previous answers\n     * @param answerer The answerer address\n     */\n    function submitAnswerFor(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        uint256 max_previous,\n        address answerer\n    ) external payable;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Submit answer by arbitrator\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @param answer The answer\n     * @param answerer The answerer address\n     */\n    function submitAnswerByArbitrator(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        address answerer\n    ) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Assign winner and submit answer by arbitrator\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @param answer The answer\n     * @param payee_if_wrong The payee if wrong\n     * @param last_history_hash The last history hash\n     * @param last_answer_or_commitment_id The last answer or commitment ID\n     * @param last_answerer The last answerer\n     */\n    function assignWinnerAndSubmitAnswerByArbitrator(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        address payee_if_wrong,\n        bytes32 last_history_hash,\n        bytes32 last_answer_or_commitment_id,\n        address last_answerer\n    ) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Submit answer commitment\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @param answer_hash The answer hash\n     * @param max_previous Maximum previous answers\n     * @param _answerer The answerer address\n     */\n    function submitAnswerCommitment(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        bytes32 answer_hash,\n        uint256 max_previous,\n        address _answerer\n    ) external payable;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Submit answer reveal\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @param answer The answer\n     * @param nonce The nonce\n     * @param bond The bond\n     */\n    function submitAnswerReveal(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        uint256 nonce,\n        uint256 bond\n    ) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Claim winnings\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @param history_hashes The history hashes\n     * @param addrs The addresses\n     * @param bonds The bonds\n     * @param answers The answers\n     */\n    function claimWinnings(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        bytes32[] calldata history_hashes,\n        address[] calldata addrs,\n        uint256[] calldata bonds,\n        bytes32[] calldata answers\n    ) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Claim multiple and withdraw balance\n     * @param question_ids The question IDs\n     * @param lengths The lengths\n     * @param hist_hashes The history hashes\n     * @param addrs The addresses\n     * @param bonds The bonds\n     * @param answers The answers\n     */\n    function claimMultipleAndWithdrawBalance(\n        bytes32[] calldata question_ids,\n        uint256[] calldata lengths,\n        bytes32[] calldata hist_hashes,\n        address[] calldata addrs,\n        uint256[] calldata bonds,\n        bytes32[] calldata answers\n    ) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Withdraw balance\n     */\n    function withdraw() external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get the Reality.eth balance of an account\n     * @param account The address to check balance for\n     * @return The balance of the account in Reality.eth\n     */\n    function balanceOf(address account) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Set question fee\n     * @param fee The fee amount\n     */\n    function setQuestionFee(uint256 fee) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Notify of arbitration request\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @param requester The requester address\n     * @param max_previous Maximum previous answers\n     */\n    function notifyOfArbitrationRequest(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        address requester,\n        uint256 max_previous\n    ) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Cancel arbitration\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     */\n    function cancelArbitration(bytes32 question_id) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get final answer if matches\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @param content_hash The content hash\n     * @param arbitrator The arbitrator address\n     * @param min_timeout The minimum timeout\n     * @param min_bond The minimum bond\n     * @return The final answer if it matches\n     */\n    function getFinalAnswerIfMatches(\n        bytes32 question_id,\n        bytes32 content_hash,\n        address arbitrator,\n        uint32 min_timeout,\n        uint256 min_bond\n    ) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get result for once settled\n     * @param question_id The question ID\n     * @return The result once settled\n     */\n    function resultForOnceSettled(bytes32 question_id) external view returns (bytes32);\n\n    // Events\n    event LogNewQuestion(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        address indexed user,\n        uint256 template_id,\n        string question,\n        bytes32 content_hash,\n        address arbitrator,\n        uint32 timeout,\n        uint32 opening_ts,\n        uint256 nonce,\n        uint256 created\n    );\n\n    event LogNewAnswer(\n        bytes32 answer,\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        bytes32 history_hash,\n        address indexed user,\n        uint256 bond,\n        uint256 ts,\n        bool is_commitment\n    );\n\n    event LogAnswerReveal(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        address indexed user,\n        bytes32 answer_hash,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        uint256 nonce,\n        uint256 bond\n    );\n\n    event LogFinalize(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        bytes32 answer\n    );\n\n    event LogClaim(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        address indexed user,\n        uint256 amount\n    );\n\n    event LogFundAnswerBounty(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        uint256 bounty_added,\n        uint256 bounty,\n        address indexed user\n    );\n\n    event LogMinimumBond(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        uint256 min_bond\n    );\n\n    event LogNotifyOfArbitrationRequest(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        address indexed user\n    );\n\n    event LogCancelArbitration(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id\n    );\n\n    event LogReopenQuestion(\n        bytes32 indexed question_id,\n        bytes32 reopened_question_id\n    );\n\n    event LogNewTemplate(\n        uint256 indexed template_id,\n        address indexed user,\n        string question_text\n    );\n\n    event LogSetQuestionFee(\n        address arbitrator,\n        uint256 amount\n    );\n\n    event LogWithdraw(\n        address indexed user,\n        uint256 amount\n    );\n}\n","keccak256":"0xd91dc6314ac233fb6fbb746153e5bb04ebeb2c33dea19b21a4c2e97eb1cd61b8","license":"MIT"},"contracts/PrecogRealityOracleV2.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity 0.7.6;\npragma abicoder v2;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/math/SafeMath.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol\";\nimport \"./IPrecogMarket.sol\";\nimport \"./IRealityETH.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title PrecogOracleRealityV1: An smart oracle implementation to report results on Precog Markets using Reality.eth\n * @author Marto (https://github.com/0xMarto) & Mati (https://github.com/0xAstraea)\n * @dev Feel free to make any adjustments to the code (DMs are open @0xMarto)\n */\ncontract PrecogRealityOracleV2 is AccessControl {\n    using SafeMath for uint256;\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20;\n\n    // Constants\n    bytes32 public constant ADMIN_ROLE = keccak256(\"ADMIN_ROLE\");\n    bytes32 public constant REPORTER_ROLE = keccak256(\"REPORTER_ROLE\");\n\n    // State objects\n    struct MarketInfo {\n        address market;       // Market contract address\n        bytes32 questionId;   // Question Identifier on Reality.eth contract\n        string outcomes;      // CSV of valid outcomes labels\n        bool answered;        // Flag that signal that a answer was submitted to Reality.eth\n        uint256 resultIndex;  // Market final result index (calculated computing all reported results)\n        string resultLabel;   // Market final result label (calculated computing all reported results)\n    }\n\n    // Public variables\n    address public precogMaster;\n    address public reality;\n    address public arbitrator;\n    uint256 public maxAnswerBond;\n    mapping(uint256 => MarketInfo) public markets;\n    mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => bool)) public marketReporters;\n\n    // Modifiers\n    modifier onlyAdmin() {\n        require(hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender), \"Only Admin\");\n        _;\n    }\n\n    modifier onlyGlobalReporter() {\n        require(hasRole(REPORTER_ROLE, msg.sender), \"Only Reporter\");\n        _;\n    }\n\n    modifier onlyMarketReporter(uint256 marketId) {\n        require(isMarketReporter(marketId, msg.sender), \"Only Market Reporter\");\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initializes the PrecogRealityOracleV1 contract\n\t * @param initialAdmin Address that will be granted the first Admin account\n\t */\n    constructor(address initialAdmin) {\n        // Grant DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE to the initial admin (this is the admin to the ADMIN_ROLE list)\n        _setupRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, initialAdmin);\n\n        // Set ADMIN_ROLE as admin of REPORTER_ROLE list\n        _setRoleAdmin(REPORTER_ROLE, ADMIN_ROLE);\n\n        // Grant ADMIN_ROLE to initial Admin (this enables to call \"addAdmin\" helper function)\n        _setupRole(ADMIN_ROLE, initialAdmin);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Registers a new market with this oracle\n\t * @dev Validates market ownership and oracle assignment before registration\n\t *      Requirements:\n\t *      - Caller must have REPORTER_ROLE\n\t *      - Market must be owned by precogMaster\n\t *      - Market must have this contract set as its oracle\n\t *      - Market ID must not be already registered\n\t * @param id Unique identifier for the market\n\t * @param market Address of the PrecogMarket contract\n\t * @param initialReporters Optional array of addresses that can report for this specific market\n\t */\n    function registerMarket(\n        uint256 id,\n        address market,\n        address[] calldata initialReporters\n    ) external onlyGlobalReporter {\n        // Verify that the current was created by the current Precog Master\n        require(IPrecogMarket(market).owner() == precogMaster, \"Invalid master\");\n\n        // Verify that the current oracle of the Market is this contract (to be able to report results)\n        require(IPrecogMarket(market).oracle() == address(this), \"Invalid market\");\n\n        // Verify that the received market id is not already registered\n        require(markets[id].market == address(0), \"Already register market\");\n\n        // Allocate storage slot for the market\n        markets[id] = MarketInfo(market, bytes32(0), \"\", false, 0, \"\");\n\n        // Register specific reporters for this market (only if the list is provided)\n        if (initialReporters.length > 0) {\n            for (uint256 i = 0; i < initialReporters.length; i++) {\n                marketReporters[id][initialReporters[i]] = true;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Opens a new question in Reality.eth for a specific market\n\t * @dev This function require that the sender `isMarketReporter`\n\t * @param marketId The market this question belongs to\n\t * @param bounty Amount of ETH to offer as question bounty\n\t * @param templateId Reality.eth template ID defining question structure\n\t * @param question The actual question text\n\t * @param outcomes Array of possible answer options\n\t * @param category Question category for organization\n\t * @param timeout Duration in seconds before question can be answered\n\t * @param startTime Timestamp when question becomes answerable\n\t * @return questionId Unique identifier of the created question in Reality.eth\n\t */\n    function openQuestion(\n        uint256 marketId,\n        uint256 bounty,\n        uint32 templateId,\n        string calldata question,\n        string[] calldata outcomes,\n        string calldata category,\n        uint32 timeout,\n        uint32 startTime\n    ) public payable onlyMarketReporter(marketId) returns (bytes32 questionId) {\n        // Verify that the market is already registered\n        require(isMarketRegistered(marketId), \"Market not registered\");\n\n        // Verify market is already registered\n        require(markets[marketId].questionId == bytes32(0), \"Question already open\");\n\n        // Open a question in Reality.eth\n        questionId = IRealityETH(reality).askQuestion{value: bounty}(\n            templateId,\n            _formatQuestion(question, outcomes, category),\n            arbitrator,\n            timeout,\n            startTime,\n            0 // Fixed nonce (as is not needed as unique identifier)\n        );\n\n        // Save the questionId and outcomes to the market\n        markets[marketId].questionId = questionId;\n        markets[marketId].outcomes = _arrayToCSV(outcomes);\n\n        // Return new question id\n        return questionId;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Submits an answer to an open Reality.eth question for a market\n\t * @dev This function require that the sender `isMarketReporter`\n\t * @param marketId The market whose question is being answered\n\t * @param answer The answer being submitted (as bytes32)\n\t * @param maxPrevious Maximum previous bond to calculate minimum new bond\n\t * @param bond Amount of ETH to bond with this answer\n\t */\n    function answerOpenQuestion(\n        uint256 marketId,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        uint256 maxPrevious,\n        uint256 bond\n    ) public payable onlyMarketReporter(marketId) {\n        // Verify that the market is already registered\n        require(isMarketRegistered(marketId), \"Market not registered\");\n\n        // Get and check question id for received market\n        bytes32 questionId = markets[marketId].questionId;\n        require(questionId != bytes32(0), \"Market Id not found\");\n\n        // Verify that this market do not have an answer\n        require(!markets[marketId].answered, \"Market already answered\");\n\n        // Verify than received bond is not higher than expected\n        require(bond <= maxAnswerBond, \"Answer bond too high\");\n\n        // Submit an answer in name of another address in Reality.eth\n        IRealityETH(reality).submitAnswer{value: bond}(\n            questionId,\n            answer,\n            maxPrevious\n        );\n\n        // Register answer on Market\n        markets[marketId].answered = true;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Submit a Market result by opening question and answering it (to be disputed or validate it)\n\t * @dev This function require that the sender `isMarketReporter`\n\t * @return questionId The unique identifier for the question\n\t */\n    function submitResult(\n        uint256 marketId,\n        uint32 templateId,\n        string calldata question,\n        string[] calldata outcomes,\n        string calldata category,\n        uint32 timeout,\n        uint32 startTime,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        uint256 bond\n    ) external payable onlyMarketReporter(marketId) returns (bytes32 questionId) {\n        // Open a question in Reality.eth with custom question text\n        questionId = openQuestion(\n            marketId,\n            0,  // Question Bounty = 0, fixed because we send `bond` in the first answer\n            templateId,\n            question,\n            outcomes,\n            category,\n            timeout,\n            startTime\n        );\n\n        // Submit answer with the remaining value (after bounty is spent)\n        answerOpenQuestion(\n            marketId,\n            answer,\n            0, // MaxPrevious Bond = 0, fixed because it is the first answer\n            bond // Answer Bond (the remainder of the tx value)\n        );\n\n        return questionId;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Report result validated by Reality.eth to corresponding Market\n     * @dev Also store validated result in local storage to be audited\n\t */\n    function reportResult(uint256 marketId) external onlyGlobalReporter {\n        bytes32 questionId = markets[marketId].questionId;\n        require(questionId != bytes32(0), \"Market Id not found\");\n\n        // Verify that the question for the received market is finalized on Reality.eth\n        require(IRealityETH(reality).isFinalized(questionId), \"Invalid question\");\n\n        // Verify that the market is not already being reported\n        require(markets[marketId].resultIndex == 0, \"Market already reported\");\n\n        bytes32 answer = IRealityETH(reality).getBestAnswer(questionId);\n        uint256 answerIndex = uint256(answer); // This is the Reality.eth 0-based index result\n\n        // Get the label for this index from the outcomes\n        string[] memory outcomes = _csvToArray(markets[marketId].outcomes);\n\n        require(answerIndex < outcomes.length, \"Invalid answer\");\n        string memory resultLabel = outcomes[answerIndex];\n\n        // The PrecogMarket contract expects a 1-based index for the result\n        uint256 resultIndex = answerIndex + 1;\n\n        // Set market result on PrecogMarket external contract\n        IPrecogMarket(markets[marketId].market).reportResult(marketId, resultIndex);\n\n        // Set result index and label on local Market\n        markets[marketId].resultIndex = resultIndex;\n        markets[marketId].resultLabel = resultLabel;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Open a question in Reality.eth without a local register market\n\t * @return questionId The unique identifier for the question\n\t */\n    function realityOpenQuestion(\n        uint256 bounty,\n        uint32 templateId,\n        string calldata question,\n        string[] calldata outcomes,\n        string calldata category,\n        uint32 timeout,\n        uint32 startTime,\n        uint32 nonce\n    ) public payable onlyGlobalReporter returns (bytes32 questionId) {\n        // Build the formatted question (internal helper will allocate memory)\n        string memory formattedQuestion = _formatQuestion(question, outcomes, category);\n\n        questionId = IRealityETH(reality).askQuestion{value: bounty}(\n            templateId,\n            formattedQuestion,\n            arbitrator,\n            timeout,\n            startTime,\n            nonce\n        );\n\n        return questionId;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Submit an answer in name of another address in Reality.eth\n\t * @param questionId The question Id to answer\n\t * @param answer The answer to submit\n\t * @param maxPrevious Maximum number of previous answers to consider\n\t * @param answerer The address submitting the answer for\n\t */\n    function realitySubmitAnswerFor(\n        uint256 bond,\n        bytes32 questionId,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        uint256 maxPrevious,\n        address answerer\n    ) public payable onlyGlobalReporter {\n        IRealityETH(reality).submitAnswerFor{value: bond}(\n            questionId,\n            answer,\n            maxPrevious,\n            answerer\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Assign winnings in Reality.eth of a question, to later claim them by the answerer\n\t * @param questionId The question Id to claim winnings for\n\t * @param historyHashes The history hashes for the claim\n\t * @param answerers The addresses involved in the claim\n\t * @param bonds The bonds for the claim\n\t * @param answers The answers for the claim\n\t */\n    function realityClaimWinnings(\n        bytes32 questionId,\n        bytes32[] calldata historyHashes,\n        address[] calldata answerers,\n        uint256[] calldata bonds,\n        bytes32[] calldata answers\n    ) external onlyGlobalReporter {\n        IRealityETH(reality).claimWinnings(\n            questionId,\n            historyHashes,\n            answerers,\n            bonds,\n            answers\n        );\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Executes a withdraw on Reality.eth contract\n\t */\n    function realityWithdraw() external onlyGlobalReporter {\n        IRealityETH(reality).withdraw();\n    }\n\n    function marketRedeemBatch(\n        uint256 marketId,\n        address[] calldata accounts\n    ) external onlyGlobalReporter returns (uint256) {\n        return IPrecogMarket(markets[marketId].market).redeemBatch(accounts);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Check if a market is already registered on this oracle\n\t */\n    function isMarketRegistered(uint256 marketId) public view returns (bool) {\n        return markets[marketId].market != address(0);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Check if an account is allowed to summit/report result for a specific Market\n\t */\n    function isMarketReporter(\n        uint256 marketId,\n        address account\n    ) public view returns (bool) {\n        // Test the account is reporter for this specific market or is a global reporter\n        return marketReporters[marketId][account] || hasRole(REPORTER_ROLE, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the permissions status of a given account.\n     * @param account The address of the account to check.\n     * @return isAdmin Indicates whether the account has the admin role.\n     * @return isGlobalReporter Indicates whether the account has the reporter role.\n     */\n    function getAccountPermissions(address account) external view returns (bool isAdmin, bool isGlobalReporter) {\n        isAdmin = hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, account);\n        isGlobalReporter = hasRole(REPORTER_ROLE, account);\n        return (isAdmin, isGlobalReporter);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the current state of a given market.\n     * @param marketId The market Id to get the current state parameters\n     * @return isRegistered Indicates whether the market is registered in the system.\n     * @return isAnswered Indicates whether the market has been answered by a reporter.\n     * @return isFinalized Indicates whether the market answer is final and the result can be reported.\n     * @return isReported Indicates whether the market's result has been reported.\n     */\n    function getMarketState(uint256 marketId) external view returns (\n        bool isRegistered,\n        bool isAnswered,\n        bool isFinalized,\n        bool isReported\n    ) {\n        // Calculate market states for the received market id\n        isRegistered = markets[marketId].market != address(0);\n        isAnswered = markets[marketId].answered;\n        isFinalized = IRealityETH(reality).isFinalized(markets[marketId].questionId);\n        isReported = markets[marketId].resultIndex > 0;\n        return (isRegistered, isAnswered, isFinalized, isReported);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Get the Reality.eth balance of this contract\n\t */\n    function getRealityBalance() external view returns (uint256) {\n        return IRealityETH(reality).balanceOf(address(this));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Get comprehensive information about a Reality Question starting settings\n\t * @param marketId The market Id to get information for\n\t */\n    function getRealityQuestionInfo(uint256 marketId) external view returns (\n        bytes32 questionId, uint32 openingTS, uint32 timeout, uint256 bounty, uint256 bond\n    ) {\n        // Get Reality question id for received market\n        questionId = markets[marketId].questionId;\n\n        // Validate existence of received market\n        require(questionId != bytes32(0), \"Market Id not found\");\n\n        // Instance Reality contract and get all needed info\n        IRealityETH realityEth = IRealityETH(reality);\n        openingTS = realityEth.getOpeningTS(questionId);\n        timeout = realityEth.getTimeout(questionId);\n        bounty = realityEth.getBounty(questionId);\n        bond = realityEth.getBond(questionId);\n\n        // Return Reality info about received market id\n        return (questionId, openingTS, timeout, bounty, bond);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Get information about a Question resolution status\n\t * @param marketId The Market Id  to get Reality result info\n\t * @return questionId question identifier\n\t * @return answer the current last or final answer value (as bytes32 index)\n\t * @return finalizeTS The pending time to reach the answer timeout\n\t * @return lastHash The history hash of the last answer\n\t * @return isFinalized Whether the question is finalized\n\t * @return isPendingArbitration Whether the question is pending arbitration\n\t */\n    function getRealityResultInfo(uint256 marketId) external view returns (\n        bytes32 questionId,\n        bytes32 answer,\n        uint32 finalizeTS,\n        bytes32 lastHash,\n        bool isFinalized,\n        bool isPendingArbitration\n    ) {\n        // Get Reality question id for received market\n        questionId = markets[marketId].questionId;\n\n        // Validate existence of received market\n        require(questionId != bytes32(0), \"Market Id not found\");\n\n        IRealityETH realityEth = IRealityETH(reality);\n        answer = realityEth.getBestAnswer(questionId);\n        finalizeTS = realityEth.getFinalizeTS(questionId);\n        lastHash = realityEth.getHistoryHash(questionId);\n        isFinalized = realityEth.isFinalized(questionId);\n        isPendingArbitration = realityEth.isPendingArbitration(questionId);\n\n        return (questionId, answer, finalizeTS, lastHash, isFinalized, isPendingArbitration);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Internal helper function that formats a question string according to Reality.eth specifications\n\t * @dev Combines question text, outcomes, and category using the Reality.eth separator '\u241f'\n\t * @param question The main question text to be asked\n\t * @param outcomes Array of possible answer options that will be presented to users\n\t * @param category The classification category for the question\n\t * @return formatedQuestion A output string in the format: \"question\u241f['outcome1','outcome2',...]\u241fcategory\u241f\"\n\t */\n    function _formatQuestion(\n        string calldata question,\n        string[] calldata outcomes,\n        string calldata category\n    ) internal pure returns (string memory formatedQuestion) {\n        // Build outcome CSV string\n        bytes memory outcomesBytes = bytes(\"\");\n        if (outcomes.length > 0) {\n            outcomesBytes = abi.encodePacked('\"', outcomes[0], '\"');\n            for (uint256 i = 1; i < outcomes.length; i++) {\n                outcomesBytes = abi.encodePacked(outcomesBytes, ',\"', outcomes[i], '\"');\n            }\n        }\n        // Build question string based on Reality custom format\n        formatedQuestion = string(\n            abi.encodePacked(question, unicode\"\u241f\", string(outcomesBytes), unicode\"\u241f\", category, unicode\"\u241f\")\n        );\n        return formatedQuestion;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Converts an array of strings into a comma-separated string\n\t * @dev Example: [\"Yes\", \"No\", \"Maybe\"] => \"Yes,No,Maybe\"\n\t * @param array The array of strings to join\n\t * @return A single string with all elements joined by commas, or empty string if array is empty\n\t */\n    function _arrayToCSV(string[] memory array) internal pure returns (string memory) {\n        if (array.length == 0) {\n            return \"\";\n        }\n\n        bytes memory csvBytes = bytes(array[0]);\n        for (uint i = 1; i < array.length; i++) {\n            csvBytes = abi.encodePacked(csvBytes, \",\", array[i]);\n        }\n        return string(csvBytes);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Splits a comma-separated string into an array of individual strings\n\t * @dev Example: \"Yes,No,Maybe\" => [\"Yes\", \"No\", \"Maybe\"]\n\t * @param csv The comma-separated string to split\n\t * @return An array of individual strings, or empty array if input is empty\n\t */\n    function _csvToArray(string memory csv) internal pure returns (string[] memory) {\n        bytes memory csvBytes = bytes(csv);\n        if (csvBytes.length == 0) {\n            return new string[](0);\n        }\n\n        // 1. Count how many elements we have\n        uint256 count = 1;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < csvBytes.length; i++) {\n            if (csvBytes[i] == \",\") {\n                count++;\n            }\n        }\n\n        // 2. Create the array and populate it\n        string[] memory result = new string[](count);\n        uint256 resultIndex = 0;\n        uint256 startIndex = 0;\n\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < csvBytes.length; i++) {\n            if (csvBytes[i] == \",\") {\n                result[resultIndex] = _substring(csvBytes, startIndex, i);\n                resultIndex++;\n                startIndex = i + 1;\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Add the last element\n        result[resultIndex] = _substring(csvBytes, startIndex, csvBytes.length);\n\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Extracts a portion of a bytes array into a new string\n\t * @dev Helper function for _csvToArray to extract individual elements\n\t * @param source The source bytes array to extract from\n\t * @param start The starting index (inclusive) in the source array\n\t * @param end The ending index (exclusive) in the source array\n\t * @return A new string containing the extracted bytes\n\t */\n    function _substring(bytes memory source, uint256 start, uint256 end) internal pure returns (string memory) {\n        uint256 len = end - start;\n        bytes memory dest = new bytes(len);\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < len; i++) {\n            dest[i] = source[start + i];\n        }\n        return string(dest);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Accept ETH for from any Transfer, Send or Call with value\n\t */\n    receive() external payable {}\n\n    // Whitelisted functions: Only admin\n    function setPrecogMaster(address master) external onlyAdmin {\n        precogMaster = master;\n    }\n\n    function setReality(address realityProxy) external onlyAdmin {\n        reality = realityProxy;\n    }\n\n    function setArbitrator(address arbitratorProxy) external onlyAdmin {\n        arbitrator = arbitratorProxy;\n    }\n\n    function setMaxAnswerBond(uint256 maxBond) external onlyAdmin {\n        maxAnswerBond = maxBond;\n    }\n\n    function addMarketReporter(\n        uint256 marketId,\n        address account\n    ) external onlyAdmin {\n        // Verify that the account is not already registered (to avoid reset 'submitted' flag)\n        require(!marketReporters[marketId][account], \"Invalid reporter\");\n\n        // Register account as reporter for the received market id\n        marketReporters[marketId][account] = true;\n    }\n\n    function removeMarketReporter(\n        uint256 marketId,\n        address account\n    ) external onlyAdmin {\n        // Verify that the account is already registered as reporter\n        require(marketReporters[marketId][account], \"Invalid reporter\");\n\n        // Disable account as allowed reporter for the received market id\n        marketReporters[marketId][account] = false;\n    }\n\n    function addReporter(address account) external onlyAdmin {\n        grantRole(REPORTER_ROLE, account);\n    }\n\n    function removeReporter(address account) external onlyAdmin {\n        revokeRole(REPORTER_ROLE, account);\n    }\n\n    function addAdmin(address account) external onlyAdmin {\n        grantRole(ADMIN_ROLE, account);\n    }\n\n    function removeAdmin(address account) external onlyAdmin {\n        revokeRole(ADMIN_ROLE, account);\n    }\n\n    function withdraw(address _token) public onlyAdmin {\n        if (_token == address(0)) {\n            payable(msg.sender).transfer(address(this).balance);\n        } else {\n            IERC20(_token).safeTransfer(\n                msg.sender,\n                IERC20(_token).balanceOf(address(this))\n            );\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x43b321164706478cff85d57ffd48caebd7c2b759370dd543005ce9ec687abb64","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.
